news.title: Mary Robinson travels to Rafah Crossing and says Israel deliberately blocking Gaza aid
news.summary: Former President of Ireland Mary Robinson has travelled to the Rafah Crossing between Egypt and Gaza, where she said Israel was deliberately blocking aid from entering the starving and war-ravaged Palestinian enclave.

news.title: Temperatures to hit 28C as Status Yellow thunderstorm warning issued for three counties
news.summary: A Status Yellow thunderstorm warning for three counties has been issued by Met Éireann.

news.title: Two teens stabbed as they slept in car in ‘planned attack’ on Dublin street
news.summary: Gardaí are following a definite line of inquiry into an early morning double stabbing incident that happened in Dublin’s south inner city.

news.title: ‘I used to go on sunbeds to get a base tan before holidays, I was stupid’ – skin cancer survivor on tanning dangers
news.summary: Gill Costelloe was at a wedding when a friend pointed out a mole on her back and urged her to get it checked out.

news.title: Lidl store in Dublin and a Kerry hotel restaurant closed by FSAI in July after rodent droppings and cockroach infestation found
news.summary: A Lidl store based in Dublin and the Brandon Hotel in Tralee, Co Kerry, were among the premises to receive closure orders issued by the Food Safety Authority of Ireland (FSAI) in July.

news.title: Everyone’s talking about: GABA drinks – can they deliver the ‘buzz’ of alcohol, minus the hangover?
news.summary: Imagine a drink that helps you relax, sleep better, and feel sociable, without the hangover or side effects of alcohol. This is the promise of SENTIA spirits, the manufacturers of a new generation of non-alcoholic GABA drinks.

news.title: Michael Verney: Those calling for censorship in hurling and camogie must be careful of the consequences
news.summary: There was something quite rare about the rant Cork camogie manager Ger Manley went on in the aftermath of their agonising All-Ireland senior final defeat to Galway.

news.title: Fancy eating your dinner at 5pm? How the early bird became cool thanks to Gen Z
news.summary: It’s 5pm on a Thursday, and tech account executive Tess Coghlan is about to head out for dinner with work pals in Dublin city centre.

news.title: Tipperary murder victim hailed as kind-hearted man who promoted Ireland’s railway heritage
news.summary: Tipperary murder victim Ian Walsh (49) was hailed as a kind-hearted man who ranked as one of Ireland's foremost rail enthusiasts and was always generously willing to share his expertise to promote Ireland's railway heritage.

news.title: Darragh McCullough: Feeling flush this year? Here’s how you might splash your extra cash
news.summary: Despite my best efforts to jinx it, 2025 is shaping up to be the most profitable year ever for Irish farmers.
